派.definition: (literary) tributary; branch of a river; clique; school; group; faction; (bound form) style; manner; to send (a person or resource); to dispatch; to allocate (a resource or task); to appoint (sb); classifier for factions, groups etc; (preceded by 一[yi]) classifier used in characterizing a scene, atmosphere, demeanor, sound, remark etc; (loanword) pi (Greek letter Ππ); the circular ratio 𝜋 = 3.14159... ; (loanword) pie

派上用場.definition: to put to good use; to come in handy

派任.definition: to set apart; to assign sb to a job

派克.definition: Pike or Peck (name); Parker Pen Company

派司.definition: (loanword); pass (for gaining admittance); to pass (in a game of bridge etc); to get through; to pass (an exam etc)

派單.definition: to hand out leaflets; (of a platform, e.g. Uber, DiDi) to dispatch orders

派生.definition: to produce (from sth else); to derive (from raw material); derivative

派購.definition: fixed government purchase (esp of farm products)

派送.definition: to send; to deliver; to distribute

派遣.definition: to send (on a mission); to dispatch

派遺.definition: to send (sb) on a mission; to dispatch

派駐.definition: to dispatch (sb) in an official capacity; to be posted (as an ambassador, foreign correspondent etc)
